content.user_title: Build React Native mobile apps with Expo
content.value_statement: Developing mobile apps requires platform-specific knowledge and command-line tools. This skill provides ready-to-use templates, best practices, and troubleshooting guidance for React Native and Expo development.
actual_capabilities: Create React Native components with proper TypeScript interfaces
Implement platform-specific code for iOS and Android
Set up and configure Expo/React Native projects
Build lists, forms, and loading states with React Native components
Apply React Native best practices for performance and accessibility
limitations: Cannot execute native build commands directly on the user's machine
Cannot install packages or modify project configuration files
Does not provide real-time debugging or device testing capabilities
Requires user to have React Native/Expo environment properly set up

use_cases.title: Component templates
use_cases.description: Get code templates for buttons, lists, forms, and other React Native components with proper styling patterns.

use_cases.title: Platform adaptation
use_cases.description: Learn to write conditional code that adapts behavior and styles between iOS and Android platforms.

use_cases.title: Build troubleshooting
use_cases.description: Resolve common Metro bundler, native module, and build failures with proven solutions.

prompt_templates.title: Create component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a React Native component with TouchableOpacity that shows a text label. Use StyleSheet.create for styling with padding, background color, and border radius.

prompt_templates.title: Platform code
prompt_templates.prompt: Write platform-specific styles using Platform.select for iOS shadow and Android elevation. Also show conditional rendering based on Platform.OS.

prompt_templates.title: List component
prompt_templates.scenario: Displaying data in a scrollable list
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a FlatList component that renders items from an array. Include keyExtractor and proper spacing between items.

prompt_templates.title: Form input
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a TextInput component with useState for value management. Include placeholder, onChangeText handler, and input styling.

output_examples.input: Create a button component with a title and press handler

best_practices: Use StyleSheet.create() for all styles instead of inline objects to improve performance
Add accessibilityLabel and accessibilityRole to interactive elements for screen readers
Test components on multiple screen sizes and both iOS and Android platforms
Keep component state minimal and use context or stores for shared state management
anti_patterns: Avoid inline style objects - they create new style objects on every render
Do not skip accessibility labels on interactive elements
Avoid Platform.OS === 'ios' checks in business logic - extract to custom hooks
Do not store large arrays in component state - use useMemo or external stores

faq.question: What tools do I need before using this skill?
faq.answer: You need Node.js, React Native CLI or Expo CLI, and Xcode for iOS or Android Studio for Android development.

faq.question: Can this skill install packages for my project?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance. You must run npm install or npx expo install commands yourself.

faq.question: Does this work with Expo Go?
faq.answer: Yes, the code patterns work with Expo Go. For native modules, use npx expo prebuild to generate native code.

faq.question: Is my project data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only provides guidance. It does not read, write, or modify any project files.

faq.question: Why is Metro bundler not starting?
faq.answer: Try clearing the cache with npx expo start --clear. Also check that port 8081 is not in use by another process.

faq.question: How does this compare to React Navigation?
faq.answer: This skill covers Expo Router and React Navigation basics. For complex navigation, refer to official navigation documentation.
